explains: adj. 狭窄的；难懂的；难辨的
v. 用夹钳夹；约束（cramp 的过去分词）

sentences.en: He is cooped up in a cramped cell with 10 other inmates.
sentences.cn: 他和其他十位犯人被关在一个拥挤的牢房中。

sentences.en: Byron was back aboard the cramped Devilfish.
sentences.cn: 拜伦又回到了狭窄的乌贼号上。

sentences.en: This means that artists were forced to work in cramped spaces and without sources of natural light.
sentences.cn: 这意味着艺术家被迫在狭小的空间里工作，并且没有自然光。
